newsitem.title: UK: NWE oil products firm as supply thins.
newsitem.headline: NWE oil products firm as supply thins.

text.p: NWE oil products were mostly stronger on Friday and traders began to feel the effects of autumn refinery maintenance.
Gasoline was steady, but there was good demand in Eastern Europe and maintenance tightened supply.
Naphtha was firm as tight Med supplies combined with greater N+A demand in northern Europe.
Gas oil cargoes were stronger as the U.S. arbitrage opened for Russian exports, but barge premiums remained under pressure.
High sulphur barges were stronger on active buying by a single trader. Cargoes were also strong on tight supply.
